title: French pedestrians see green light, even when it's red: study
text:
Minnesota pedestrian death spike illustrates grim US trend January 5, 2017 
Pedestrian deaths spiked to a 25-year high in Minnesota in 2016, illustrating what's been a grim upward trend across the country in recent years. Experts tie it to more people driving and to more distractions such as smartphones ... London launches hi-tech trial for pedestrian safety March 11, 2014 
(Phys.org) —London is trying out intelligent pedestrian technology to make crossing the road easier and safer. Announced earlier this month, the technology is said to be the first scheme of its kind in the world. The Mayor ... Walk, but stay safe: tips for pedestrians January 20, 2014 
(HealthDay)—Walking is a great way to get exercise, but it's important to follow certain safety rules to protect yourself from cars and other hazards, experts say. Most older pedestrians are unable to cross the road in time: study June 13, 2012 
The ability to cross a road in time is one that most of us take for granted. A new study published in the journal Age and Ageing, entitled 'Most Older Pedestrians are unable to cross the road in time: a cross-sectional study', ... Cell phone conversations hinder child pedestrian crossing abilities August 30, 2016 
Researchers at Ben-Gurion University of the Negev (BGU) have determined that a child pedestrian's ability to safely cross the road is hindered more during a cell phone conversation than an adult's. The study will be published ... Over 270,000 pedestrians killed each year May 2, 2013 
More than 270,000 pedestrians are killed on the world's roads each year, the World Health Organisation said Thursday, slamming decades of neglect in favour of vehicle transportation. Recommended for you French pedestrians see green light, even when it's red: study February 15, 2017 
French pedestrians have the reputation of being a law unto themselves—but an unusual study has provided some scientific backing for the stereotype. 'Field patterns' as a new mathematical object February 14, 2017 
University of Utah mathematicians propose a theoretical framework to understand how waves and other disturbances move through materials in conditions that vary in both space and time. The theory, called "field patterns," ... Fossil discovery rewrites understanding of reproductive evolution (Update) February 14, 2017 
A remarkable 250 million-year-old "terrible-headed lizard" fossil found in China shows an embryo inside the mother—clear evidence for live birth. Level up and learn: Team teaches science through video game February 14, 2017 
A University of Texas at Dallas team is exploring whether teaching real-world science through a popular computer game may offer a more engaging and effective educational approach than traditional concepts of instruction. February 14, 2017 
Researchers have unlocked the mystery of why people have seen so many different images in Rorschach inkblots. Romanian skeleton puzzles archaeologists February 14, 2017 
An unusual and 'confusing' grave site dug up in Romania by a student from The Australian National University (ANU) is helping provide evidence for the first official written history of the Székely people.
